HTML_page1.title: HTML Page: 1
HTML_page1.text:
<WordWrap><!DOCTYPE html> declaration: Specifies the document type in HTML5.%img('HTML_Declare')
<a> tag: Used to create hyperlinks that navigate users to different webpages or sections.%img('HTML_alink')
<audio> tag: Used to embed an audio file in an HTML document.%img('HTML_audio')
autoplay attribute: Used within the <video> tag to play a video automatically when the page loads.%img('HTML_videosrc')
br tag: Inserts a line break in text, moving content to the next line.%img('HTML_br')
controls attribute: Added to the <audio> tag to provide playback controls such as play, pause, and volume.%img('HTML_audio')
<footer> tag: Defines the footer section of a webpage, often containing copyright, links, or additional information.%img('HTML_footer')
<h1> tag: Represents the most important heading on a page.%img('HTML_H1')
<html> tag: The root element of an HTML document, enclosing all other elements.%img('HTML_Declare')<WordWrap>

HTML_page2.title: HTML Page: 2
HTML_page2.text:
HTML comment (): Allows developers to add notes within the code without affecting webpage display.%img('11_HTML_COMMENT') tag: Used to make text italicized, often for emphasis.%img('12_HTML_TAG') tag: Used to embed images in a webpage. Example: %img('13_HTML_IMG')

tag: Used to create paragraphs of text.%img('14_HTML_P') tag: Defines an HTML table to display tabular data.%img('15_HTML_TABLE')
tag: Defines a header cell in an HTML table, usually appearing bold and centered by default.%img('16_HTML_TH') tag: Defines the title of a webpage, which appears on the browser tab.%img('17_HTML_TITLE') <tr> tag: Specifies a row in an HTML table, containing cells defined by <td> or <th>.%img('18_HTML_TR') <ul> tag: Used to create an unordered list where items are marked with bullets.%img('19_HTML_UL') <video> tag: Used to embed a video file in an HTML document.%img('20_HTML_VIDEO')<WordWrap>

HTML_page3.title: HTML Page: 3
HTML_page3.text:
<WordWrap><tr> tag: Defines a table row in an HTML table.%img('21_HTML_TRTAG')Output:%img('21_HTML_TRTAGOUTPUT')
<td> tag: Defines a table cell within an HTML table row.%img('22_HTML_TDTAG')Output:%img('22_HTML_TDTAGOUTPUT')
colspan attribute: Merges two or more columns in an HTML table.%img('23_HTML_COLSPAN')Output:%img('23_HTML_COLSPANOUTPUT')
<div> element: Groups block elements and serves as a container for styling and layout.%img('24_HTML_DIVELEMENT')Output:%img('24_HTML_DIVELEMENTOUTPUT')
<span> element: Used for inline styling and formatting within text content.%img('25_HTML_SPANELEMENT')Output:%img('25_HTML_SPANELEMENTOUTPUT')
<meta> tag: Provides metadata about an HTML document, such as character encoding and descriptions.%img('26_HTML_METATAG')
<meta charset='UTF-8'>: Specifies the character encoding for proper text display.%img('27_HTML_METACHARSET')
<script> tag: Embeds JavaScript code or links an external JavaScript file.%img('28_HTML_SCRIPTTAG')Output:%img('28_HTML_SCRIPTTAGOUTPUT')
src attribute in <script>: Specifies the source URL of an external JavaScript file.%img('29_HTML_SRCATTRI')
<nav> element: Defines a section containing navigation links for a webpage.%img('30_HTML_NAVELEMENT')Output:%img('30_HTML_NAVELEMENTOUTPUT')<WordWrap>

HTML_page4.title: HTML Page: 4
HTML_page4.text:
<WordWrap><form> tag: Defines an HTML form for user input submission.%img('31_HTML_FORMTAG')Output:%img('31_HTML_FORMTAGOUTPUT')
action attribute in <form>: Specifies the URL where form data is sent after submission.%img('32_HTML_ACTIONATTRI')
password input type: Creates a password field that hides entered text.%img('33_HTML_PASSWORD')Output:%img('33_HTML_PASSWORDOUTPUT')
<button> element: Creates a clickable button in an HTML document.%img('34_HTML_BUTTONELEMENT')Output:%img('34_HTML_BUTTONELEMENTOUTPUT1')%img('34_HTML_BUTTONELEMENTOUTPUT2')
<select> tag: Defines a dropdown menu for selecting options.%img('35_HTML_SELECTTAG')Output:%img('35_HTML_SELECTTAGOUTPUT')
required attribute: Specifies that an input field must be filled before submitting a form.%img('36_HTML_REQUIREDATTRI')
<em> tag: Defines emphasized text, typically displayed in italics.%img('37_HTML_EMTAG')Output:%img('37_HTML_EMTAGOUTPUT')
target='_blank' attribute: Opens a hyperlink in a new browser tab or window.%img('38_HTML_TARGETBLANKATTRI')Output:%img('38_HTML_TARGETBLANKATTRIOUTPUT')
<blockquote> tag: Defines a block-level quotation from another source.%img('39_HTML_BLOCKQUOTETAG')Output:%img('39_HTML_BLOCKQUOTETAGOUTPUT')
<article> tag: Represents a self-contained section of content, such as a blog post or news article.%img('40_HTML_ARTICLETAG')Output:%img('40_HTML_ARTICLETAGOUTPUT')<WordWrap>

CSS_page1.title: CSS Page: 1
CSS_page1.text:
<WordWrap>background-color property: Specifies the background color of an element.%img('1_CSS_BACKGROUND')
background-color property (default: transparent): The default background color of elements in CSS.%img('2_CSS_BACKGROUNDTRANSPARENT')
border property: Applies a border to an element in CSS. Example: border: 1px solid black;.%img('3_CSS_BORDER')
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets): A stylesheet language used to control the presentation and layout of HTML documents.%img('4_CSS')
class attribute: Used to apply multiple CSS classes to an element. Example: class='firstClass secondClass'.%img('5_CSS_CLASSATTRIBUTE')%img('5_CSS_CLASSATTRIBUTE2')
element selector: Selects all elements of a particular type in CSS.%img('6_CSS_ELEMENTSELECTOR')
em unit: A relative unit in CSS for font sizes, based on the parent element's font size.%img('7_CSS_EMUNIT')
font-size property: Controls the size of text in an element.%img('8_CSS_FONTSIZE')
font-weight property: Used to make text bold in CSS.%img('9_CSS_FONTWEIGHT')
ID selector (#): Used to target an element with a specific ID in CSS.%img('10_CSS_IDSELECTOR')<WordWrap>

CSS_page2.title: CSS Page: 2
CSS_page2.text:
tag: The correct way to apply an external CSS file to an HTML document.%img('11_CSS_LINKTAG' line-height property: Controls the space between lines of text.%img('12_CSS_LINEHEIGHT')%img('12_HTML_TAG') margin property: Controls the space outside an element’s border.%img('13_CSS_MARGIN') p selector: Used to apply styles to all

elements in CSS.%img('14_CSS_PSELECRTOR') position property (default: static): Defines how an element is positioned on a webpage. The default value is static.%img('15_CSS_POSITION') style attribute: Used for applying inline CSS to an individual HTML element.%img('16_CSS_STYLE') style attribute in

: Used to apply an inline style to a
element. Example:
.%img('17_CSS_STYLEINDIV')

CSS_page3.title: CSS Page: 3
CSS_page3.text: <WordWrap>The display: none property is used to hide an element.%img('21_CSS_DISPLAYNONE')The z-index property controls the stacking order of elements.%img('22_CSS_Z-INDEX')The font-style property is used to make text italic in CSS.%img('23_CSS_FONTSTYLEEXAMPLE') Output: %img('23_CSS_FONTSTYLEOUTPUT')The :first-child pseudo-class selects the first child of an element.%img('24_CSS_FIRSTCHILDPSEUDOCLASSEXAMPLE')Output: %img('24_CSS_FIRSTCHILDPSEUDOCLASSOUTPUT')A class selector is written with a dot (.) before the class name (e.g., .classname).%img('25_CSS_CLASSSELECTOREXAMPLE')Output: %img('25_CSS_CLASSSELECTOROUTPUT')The unit sec is not a valid CSS unit.%img('26_CSS_UNITSEC')The border-radius property is used to create rounded corners.%img('27_CSS_BORDERRADIUSEXAMPLE')Output: %img('27_CSS_BORDERRADIUSOUTPUT')The max-width: 100% property makes an image responsive.%img('28_CSS_MAXWIDTH')The padding property adds space inside an element, between the content and the border.%img('29_CSS_PADDING')Output: %img('29_CSS_PADDINGOUTPUT')The relative value of the position property positions the element relative to its normal position.%img('30_CSS_RELATIVEVALUEEXAMPLE')Output: %img('30_CSS_RELATIVEVALUEOUTPUT')<WordWrap>

CSS_page4.title: CSS Page: 4
CSS_page4.text: <WordWrap>The color property changes the text color of an element.%img('31_CSS_COLOR')Output: %img('31_CSS_COLOROUTPUT')The px unit stands for pixels in CSS.%img('32_CSS_PXUNIT')Output: %img('32_CSS_PXUNITOUTPUT')The opacity property controls the transparency of an element.%img('33_CSS_OPACITY')Output: %img('33_CSS_OPACITYOUTPUT')The element selector applies styles to all elements of a specific type.%img('34_CSS_ELEMENTSELECTOR')Output: %img('34_CSS_ELEMENTSELECTOROUTPUT')The :last-child pseudo-class selects the last child of an element.%img('35_CSS_LASTCHILDPSEUDOCLASS')Output: %img('35_CSS_LASTCHILDPSEUDOCLASSOUTPUT')The display: none property removes an element from the layout flow.%img('36_CSS_DISPLAYNONE')Output: %img('36_CSS_DISPLAYNONEOUTPUT')The default flex-direction in a flex container is row.%img('37_CSS_DEFAULTFLEX')Output:%img('37_CSS_DEFAULTFLEXOUTPUT')The position: sticky property makes an element stick to the viewport while scrolling.%img('38_CSS_POSITIONSTICKY')Output:%img('38_CSS_POSITIONSTICKYOUTPUT')The transform: rotate() function is used to rotate an element.%img('39_CSS_TRANSFORMROTATE')Output:%img('39_CSS_TRANSFORMROTATEOUTPUT')The @media rule is used in CSS to apply different styles based on screen width.%img('40_CSS_MEDIARULE')Output:%img('40_CSS_MEDIARULEOUTPUT')<WordWrap>

Python_page1.title: Python Page: 1
Python_page1.text: <WordWrap># for comments: In Python, comments start with #.% operator (modulus operator): Returns the remainder of a division operation.** operator for exponentiation: Used to calculate powers of numbers.// operator (floor division): Performs division and rounds down to the nearest whole number..py extension: The correct file extension for Python files.<class 'list'> output: print(type([])) returns <class 'list'> because [] represents a list.Checking equality (== operator): The == operator is used to compare two values in Python.Defining a function using def: Functions in Python are defined using the def keyword.For loop: Used to iterate over a sequence (list, tuple, string, etc.).For loop with end parameter: The end parameter in print() controls how the output is displayed.<WordWrap>

Python_page2.title: Python Page: 2
Python_page2.text: <WordWrap>Invalid Python data types: real, byte, character, integer, number. These are not valid data types in Python. Instead, Python uses int, float, str, list, tuple, dict, set, and bool.len() function: Counts the number of characters in a string.List declaration: Lists in Python are created using square brackets [].Modulus operation (% operator): Computes the remainder when dividing two numbers.Print function (print()): Used to display output in Python.String data type (str): Used to store sequences of characters (strings) in Python.Valid variable name: A variable name in Python can start with a letter or an underscore but cannot start with a number or special characters.Variable assignment: Python assigns variables using =.<WordWrap>

Python_page3.title: Python Page: 3
Python_page3.text: <WordWrap>A list is a mutable data type in Python.The output of print(range(5)) in Python 3 is range(0, 5).The correct way to specify a default value for a function parameter is def func(x = 10):.The init method is used to create an instance of a class in Python.The a mode is used to open a file for writing while preserving existing content.The code print(10 / 0) produces a ZeroDivisionError.The correct way to create a list of squares of numbers from 1 to 5 is [x*x for x in range(1,6)].Python’s del statement deletes an object reference.The correct way to import a module in Python is import [module] or import [module] as [acronym].The break statement is used to exit a loop in Python before it naturally terminates.<WordWrap>

Python_page4.title: Python Page: 4
Python_page4.text: <WordWrap>The elif keyword is used in Python to specify multiple conditions in an if-else statement.The not operator is used to invert a Boolean value in Python.A tuple is an immutable data type in Python, meaning its elements cannot be modified after creation.The set data structure in Python is used to store unique, unordered elements.The pass statement in Python is a placeholder that allows code execution to continue without error.The try-except block is used in Python to handle exceptions and prevent program crashes.The lambda keyword is used to define anonymous functions in Python.The class keyword is used to define a class in Python.The super() function is used in Python to call methods from a parent classThe is operator in Python checks if two variables refer to the same object in memory.<WordWrap>
